titles: The plovvmans art in vvoeing the brisk young plowman doth believe if he were put to tryal, there's not a maid in all the shire could give him the denyal. Tune of, Cupid's Trappan.
publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, at the Golden Ball in West-Smith-field.,
notes: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "I am a young man that do follow the plow ..."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
